Title:
Good day. I am writing this email whilst sitting at King Shaka Airport - Durban. Utterly disgraceful and humiliating service from all staff members of FlySafair at boarding gate NAMELY - VALENCIA. This is Mohamed. I was taking the 21:40pm flight from Dur - Jnb (OR TAMBO) and i checked in online 24 hours before. I received my seat number and boarding pass via email and was clearly aware that the boarding gate closes 15 minutes prior which was 21:25pm. I was coming from Umhlanga and there was construction on the road - altought there was major traffic and delays - i knew i checked in online and just had to get to the boarding gate. I arrive inside the airport at 21:20 and i was boarding at gate A14 which was a 30 second run from the security gate. I knew i had a minute or two so i ran along with my sister who was travelling with me and reached in under 30 seconds which means i was there at 21:25 on the dot. Infront of me was the staff named Valencia (an african lady) who was escorting a standby passenger into the boarding gate and i was probably roughly around 2-3 feet behind her. She clearly heard me running yet walked into the gate and shut the door. I pleaded to her that i was right here at 21:25 on the dot and that i was just behind her so why cannot i be let in. She told me they have already taken standby passengers so i informed her how can you take standby passengers when booked passengers like my sister and i - are already here and on top of it all , we are ON TIME / JUST ON TIME. It does not make any sense. She continued to revoke me and i raised my voice because this was the last flight of the night , it was a SUNDAY and i have work the next day in JNB. She used language words on me such as “JWAYELANI” and since i am brought up in KZN , i clearly know the meaning of it and this is disgraceful that safair can have crew of this nature working for them. I wrote my matric final exams 5 years ago and on my final paper i was on the last question and the government examiner noticed this and gave me 2 more minutes to complete my paper. But this is not the case because i was JUST ON TIME. I am stating this because if even i was a minute or 2 late - this is not acceptable that situations cannot be understoof. If i was there 5-10 minutes after gate closed and planes doors are closed - that is a different situation. By taking standby passengers it means they are still processing passenger and that the plane door is still open. How were standby passengers already being processed at 21:25 when the boarding gates just closed and we were there. The only difference was they were taken inside but not us. This is not justifiable at all that i have to miss opening my business and loose my customers of the day because Valencia AND TEAM was so negligent in doing their part and understanding that i am on time and i am here so how can preference be given to a standby customer. A short indian lady from the boarding gate came to explain to me why they not allowing me and that im late took 5-7 minutes to explain and justify herself when she can take 15 seconds and process both my sister and i. This is disgraceful and i had to pay R300 for me and R300 for my sister to be put at a 6:15am flight as a STANDBY. Title:
Good day



I booked a flight with the details per the subject line for myself: FLIGHT- 20 JUNE 2022- 8.05PM- REF: UEWON4



The flight boarded just after 8pm. After about 20 minutes of boarding and no departure, the captain announced that there was a technical issue with the aircraft and that the engineers are working on it and we should be ready to go within 15 minutes.

An hour had then passed and there was still no take off. The captain then announced that it would be another 15 minutes and it was a small issue with the aircons only and once filters were changed, the plane would be good to go.

After 2 hours stuck on the plane, crew allowing no one off (holding us like hostages) on a plane filled to capacity of nearly 150 people with no aircons on (under covid circumstances), we requested waters from the cabin crew, who simply ignored our numerous requests.



After the 2 hours stuck on the plane, the captain announced that the flight was ready to go and the engineers signed off the paperwork.

On departure, whilst on the runway, it was simply clear to the passengers that the plane was not receiving enough power to basically take off the run way. Any normal person could tell this. The pilot however, at his own discretion ( or advice from SAFair) decided to fly the aircraft anyway, knowing the risks.



As a frequent flyer, I am fully aware, as are others, at the rate that an aircraft it suppose to gain altitude etc.

However, 10 minutes into the flight, the plane was cruising at a really low altitude, where peoples houses, cars and road ways were still clearly visible from the aircraft. This was already a concern as it was quite noticeable that the aircraft was no longer ascending/gaining further altitude.



The Pilot then called cabin crew to the cockpit which was clearly an emergency. Passengers were now aware that there was an issue.



The Pilot announced about 15 minutes into the flight that there was another technical issue with the aircraft and that it was not gaining pressure and that if we continued with the flight, we would not make it to the destination (JHB to Durban) as we would run out of fuel.

A few minutes later, he announced that we would need to make an emergency landing that would occur within 5 minutes, that all passengers must take the brace position and follow the crews instruction to disembark one the aircraft was grounded.



This caused distress amongst the passengers as the aircraft was not near any safe landing spots.



The pilot , somehow, managed to get the aircraft back to OR Tambo and thankfully landed the plane safely.



There was no need to cause such panic and distress to passengers.



Upon landing, again, a considerable period of time passed and they did not allow anyone off the aircraft, let alone offer a bottle of water…knowing that there are children and elderly people on the flight. No communication was put forward to advise passengers of what was happening.



Once they eventually let everyone off the plane, around 11pm, they loaded the 150 odd people on merely 2 busses at the airport (again, under covid circumstances and locked the bus doors) and held us on the bus for nearly an hour, with no communication to the passengers once again.



They eventually advised just after 11pm that they have arranged an alternative plane. At this point, after the trauma and considering the time of night, many passengers, including myself refused to get onto another flight after the traumatic experience caused by the pure blatant negligence of the Fly SAfair crew and pilot. They decided to risk peoples lives knowingly!



There was no one for loved ones to contact in an emergency situation at FLY SAfair, not at the call center nor at the service desks at the airport.



When I called Fly SAfair on 22/06/2022 at around 9.20am and requested a refund, they advised that since “we got onto the flight, they would not refund the money” and Keven Scheepers confirmed that “it was not that bad.” Again, pure disregard for people, the trauma caused by the airline, and the inconvenience caused by them, let alone the risk that they placed peoples lives in. I requested to speak to a manager and was advised that a Thuli would contact me “WHEN SHE HAS TIME”, a call that I still await.



I would advise anyone looking to use this airline not to do so. They have complete disregard for safety. The crew, pilots, call center agents are all of no assistance whatsoever! This situation could have been avoided as it was clear as day that the aircraft was not safe to fly, yet they took the chance.



Hope this helps someone when deciding to use this airline!

Title:
I would go so far as to say I will never use another airline for travelling in South Africa. For me, from now on it will always be Safair! What an awesome experience!

My husband and i fly at least twice a year, and have always used one of the other popular airlines. This time when I tried booking a couple of months ago, I could find nothing that suited my date or time,at a reasonable price. I was at my wits end as i did not want to spend so much on tickets. Looking around online to see if there werent any other options, I came across Safair. I didnt even know about such an airline, and at first thought it was a cargo plane. On lookinf further, I was surprised and thrilled to see seats were available for both the times and dates i wanted. And what was even more amazing was the fact that the price was half of what the other airlines were charging.

Booking online was easy, and I was able to receive and print confirmation immediately. I must admit I was a bit apprehensive about our flight - was "goedkoop" going to be "duurkoop"........

Well...... what a wonderful surprise! Check-in was effortless, staff were friendly and helpful, and boarding was on time. The flight itself was very pleasant - the flight attendants friendly and professional, as was the pilot. The plane itself was clean and in good condition. After landing, everything was waiting for us, so in no time, a matter of minutes, we were out of the plane and on our way to fetch our baggage. This too was ready and on the carousel, and then we were on our way home.

All in all, we highly recommend this airline - for us there will never be another.

Title: When it was announced that our pilot was female, I became concerned, not because I am chauvinistic, but because who ever flies into the East London airport has to be highly skilled as only the best are able to land a plane in the windiest conditions in the country. In the past 30 years my wife and I have flown into East London airport while the plane has been thrown about the sky by the strong winds. Twice the winds have almost pushed the plane into the ground and once at the last second the very experienced pilot had to abort, pull up the landing wheels, send the plane staggering skywards just when we were about to touch the runway. Then due to the wind he had to fly out to sea and circle for half an hour before he could return and bring us down safely. Our grandson (4 years) was travelling with us and thought that this was an amazing roller coaster ride, while the rest of us including the air hostesses needed a change of underwear. Normally when landing, the pilots bring the plane in at a fast angle and then at the last moment correct and slam the plane down onto the runway. So my concern was more that, does she have the experience and nerve to land us safely? Well, she aced the landing in very strong winds, a tribute to her skill and training. The cabin staff were excellent, attentive and helpful. Thank you Fly Safair, we will be back.
qwuub: The pilot was female and extremely good.

Title: I actually wanted to give this airline a better rating, as their prices are very cheap and the staff are all very friendly and professional, but my average rating reflects on an experience I had on my first flight of 3 in the past month. No need to print the boarding pass or pay for an sms to send it to your phone, it got sent to my email, which is on my phone, so I just downloaded it and by checking in show them my boarding pass on the phone along with my ID.I do recommend this airline and will use them again

I would love to say Safair was good value for money, however I cannot because I firmly believe ALL South African domestic flights are way overpriced.

Title:
FlySafair were far cheaper than other options between PE and CPT for a Sunday afternoon - the BA/Comair and SAA options were at least 1.5x the price.

Boarding was quick and efficient, after we watched the PE ground staff turn the plane that had just arrived from CPT in a mere 20 minutes. In such quick turns, one usually expects to find rubbish in the cabin etc. but everything was clean and ready to go when we boarded.

Once aboard, cabin crew were fresh-faced and handled a range of challenges well - including infants and a guy who couldn't fit his stuff in the overhead bin. We departed quickly and had a lovely flight over to CPT, arriving over 15 minutes early. It would have been nice to hear a PA from the flight crew before reaching cruise altitude (the first we heard from them), but there probably wasn't time given the PE terminal's proximity to the runway.

While Safair's fleet is showing their age (our aircraft was at least 25 years old - with doubler strips visible at various points on the fuselage, and lots of loose rubber flying about in spaces in the wing controls), they provided a timely, efficient, and safe operation for a reasonable price. They have such a fantastic reputation worldwide and I now understand why. I don't think people realize just how stressful their jobs can be. To the two pilots and crew from that SAFAIR flight. I will never ever, under any circumstances, use FlySafair again! Their lack of service is not worth my hard earned money! I fly often for work, but I will not support this airline again.

Title:
We travelled from Perth to Johannesburg with SAA, collected our two suitcases and checked them in at the Safair counter. we were made to sign, on the boarding pass, that there were no iPads or cellular phones in the suitcases.
Upon arriving at the hotel in Cape Town we realised that both suitcases were broken into (we realised that only at the hotel, as the suitcase closures were organised as if nothing was wrong). One suitcase locking system was broken in a way that it could still be locked. On the other, the zipper was broken, and therefore unsuitable for further travel.
Nothing was stolen, as there were only clothing and shoes in the suitcases.
When contacting the airline offices we were told to go to the police.
We were in Cape Town for only a week and were not prepared to spend time at police and insurance offices.
Our main issue is with the airline. If they make us sign at check-in that there are no electronic devices in the suitcase, they obviously know there is a problem.
So, either solve the problem, or, send the passengers to wrap their suitcases in plastic wrap.
In many years of travel, it was the first time that our luggage was broken into, and this leaves a bad impression and decreases ones desire to re-visit South Africa.

Title:
Overall: Super efficient no nonsense offering, with easy check in procedure and most importantly before time arrival.

Pros:
- very reasonably one way fares, though checked in luggage is R100 per bag.
- easy to use web check in and availability to make use of boarding pass printing at the airport (at least in CPT and PLZ).
- reasonable in flight drink prices.

Cons:
- their mobile website is rather poor, making it difficult to use.
- don't participate in a mileage program, whereas on SAA miles can be earned on the Star Alliance program.

Whilst referring this review to my most recent flight to PLZ I want to add that each flight I had so far with Safair departed early and arrived early. This is a low cost airline and as such their is no free in flight service as well as no in flight entertainment, which in the age of tablets is easily forgivable.

The seats are not designed for long haul flights and table trays are just poor. Legroom is surprisingly big and beats long haul Emirates or Delta easily.

Service was as always professional and not in any way different from SAA. Personally I try to avoid the failing yet highly subsidized national carrier and rather support small start ups like Safair or Comair.

The planes are of the older generation and I believe one machine was an old Al Italia airbus :), which is something to be aware off that probably most machines are "refurbished" older planes.

I recommend anyone flying nationally to give them a try and see for yourself if it is not possible to say goodbye to SAA and BA.
